page.title: 13MANOR FARM BRATTELBY
page.content: Mr. and Mrs. Marris, Nicholas, Julian and Caroline live on a farm in Brattelby. Nicholas works on the farm and is going to take his H.N.D. in September. The farm house is made out of stone and was built in 1850. The farm consists of 210 acres. On the farm they grow seven different types of crops. They sow winter wheat and barley in October and the fields are 82 and 20 acres. The spring barley and sugarbeet is sown in March and the fields are 25 and 20 acres. Oil seed rape is sown in early September and the field is 20 acres. Sugarbeet has to be sown in light soil 45cm. apart with a special drill. They have 30 acres of grass land. Potatoes are sown in March to April in a 10 acre field. They sow grass and clover for extra goodness because there is calcium in clover.
